meanings.sent1: After a long nap, the alarm clock helped me rewaken.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the rising sun rewakens the sleeping flowers.
meanings.sent3: The snooze button on the alarm clock decided to rewaken the dozing student.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh coffee in the morning rewakens my senses like magic.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds outside my window rewakened me to the beauty of the new day.

meanings.definition: To rouse from sleep or inactivity
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside my window rewakened me from my deep slumber.
meanings.sent2: The smell of breakfast cooking downstairs rewakens the whole family on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rewakened the tired old dog for a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm rewakened the sleepy town with its booming sounds.
meanings.sent5: The morning sunlight streaming through the curtains rewakens the room with warmth and light.

meanings.definition: To revive or restore to consciousness
meanings.sent1: The doctor used smelling salts to rewaken the fainting patient.
meanings.sent2: CPR training can teach you how to rewaken someone who has stopped breathing.
meanings.sent3: The slapstick comedy show managed to rewaken the bored audience with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology rewakened the friendship that had been strained.
meanings.sent5: The shocking news rewakened memories of the past that had been forgotten.
